column4: hi, i just instslled ubuntu as a second OS on my laptop, all seem well, but it doesnot recognise the usb wireless nic i have. how do i install a driver dor the usb device from the cd ?
what type of adaptor is it?
its an 802.11g dynamode
WL-GI-600s to be exact
ACTUALLY its - WL-GI-700s
check the wiki and help docs: https://wiki.ubuntu.com, you may have to use the ndiswrapper and the windows driver to make it work,
k, thanks

you could also try to open a console and type 'lsusb' this will list some usb info, your device will have an 8 digit number in the form of 'nnnn nnnn' try google this number and it may get you some answers
ok, will do that. what would be the prefered way ?
an open source driver from the manuf is preffered :), but that may not happen! ndiswrapper is widely used and should give good results.
ok, thanks
basically ndiswrapper allows you to use the windows driver
how do i get the ndiswapper?
I was under the impression that it comes in the standard kernel
you may want to install ndiswrapper-utils, This may help you configure your card. I am pretty sure the help docs are very good on this subject.
where can i find it ?
i can only find ndiswrapper on amd machines there
can i find it on my system tools somewhere?
As I said, I think it is in ubuntu kernel by default, on your system open  a console and type : locate ndiswrapper.ko
k, thanks
that 'should' show you if you have the kernel module, then follow the help docs
